feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 06 at 3:48PM AKST until December 07 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST THURSDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Thursday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 3:23PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORM FORCE LOW LIKELY SATURDAY... A strong, developing storm force low moving up from the south will bring strong winds, high seas, and heavy rain for the southern panhandle and outer coast. Adjustments in the track of the low will cause different impacts for each part of the panhandle, however, the southern panhandle and outer coast are likely to see the strongest

entry.title: Extreme Fire Danger issued December 07 at 2:27AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: .DISCUSSION...Very High to Extreme Fire Danger is expected today. Mild temperatures, combined with dry conditions and gusty winds, will create elevated fire weather conditions. Gusts of 50 to 60+ mph are expected, especially across southwestern SD. Winds will diminish overnight, but breezy winds are expected again on Friday and Saturday. Elevated fire weather conditions will continue.
